data.name: Draw a triangle
data.description:
Given the *width* of the base of the triangle. Draw a triangle based on the given *width*. The triangle should contain: - **Base** - the symbol `_` participates as blocks of the base. The base should be wrapped in the left and right walls.
Example of the base of the triangle with a width of 3. There're 3 `_` characters and walls on the sides: ```text /____\ ``` - **Walls**. Wall can be: left - `/` or right - `\`. Walls should be separated by a space sign ` `.
The separator from the edge of the console to the beginning of the left wall is also a space sign ` `.
Example of triangle walls for the first and second lines: ```text / \ / \ ``` - **Header** - either the symbol `^`, or a combination of the left and right walls `/\`, depending on which of the options is more suitable for the situation.
Example of using the header with a width of 1: ```text ^ /_\ ``` Example of using the header with a width of 2: ```text /\ /__\ ``` If the header is used incorrectly, its lines will not converge with the lines of the walls. Examples of **incorrect** header usage: 
 ^
/__\

  ^
/__\

 /\
 / \
/___\

  /\
 / \
/___\
